Company Overview:
Newton Investment Management Limited is an active investment management firm, using thematic ideas about the long-term investment landscape to create and manage strategies that help secure clients’ futures. Newton thinks on a global basis, with its single London-based investment team working collaboratively across asset classes and regions. The firm builds bold solutions, designed to meet the real-world challenges clients face, and the team manage them responsibly in the broadest sense – through embedding environmental, social and governance considerations, and engaging on issues that affect their clients. Those clients are based around the world, and include pension funds, corporations and charities and, via Newton’s parent company BNY Mellon, individuals. 
 
With offices in London and New York, Newton has £55bn (as at 30 September 2017) under management, including assets managed by Newton Investment Management Limited as dual officers of Newton Capital Management Limited and The Bank of New York Mellon. News and other information about Newton is available at www.newton.co.uk and via Twitter: @NewtonIM
 
Newton employees are bright, inquisitive, thoughtful and collaborative. They are highly motivated to deliver performance and service to clients.  Newton prides itself on being an employer of choice, with a flexible working environment and a commitment to diversity and opportunity among its employees.  
 
Newton is a professional, friendly and collegiate place to work. The firm looks to attract individuals who are keen to work as part of a team, in a meritocratic environment, and who are driven to help make the organisation a great place to work.  
Job Purpose:
The primary objective of the Relationship Manager EMEA is to strengthen Newton’s partnership with BNY Mellon Investment Management EMEA (IM EMEA) and APAC (IM APAC) in order to maximise Newton’s exposure and opportunities in the EMEA & APAC regions and including both institutional and intermediary channels. Collaborating closely with fellow members of the Newton Partnered Distribution team and Newton’s Investment Specialist located in APAC, this multi-faceted role includes the following responsibilities: 

Product advocacy – educate and empower the BNY Mellon IM distribution teams, expand coverage of Newton strategies.

Business development – collaborate with IM EMEA & APAC sales and Newton teams to identify, develop, assist with and monitor business opportunities for Newton.

Relationship management – contribute to the management of the distribution relationship, enhancing processes, influencing the distribution agenda, driving accountability, establishing appropriate governance.

Client servicing – support the servicing of IM EMEA & APAC clients to ensure a high quality level of service which is aligned to Newton’s client service capability where possible.
In order to execute these responsibilities, the Relationship Manager must develop and continually enhance an in-depth knowledge of investment management, the business and the portfolios/strategies most relevant to the EMEA & APAC regions, conveying this knowledge to all key stakeholders as required.  In doing so, the Relationship Manager will ensure that Newton’s solutions, as well as Newton’s/BNY Mellon’s messaging and investment-related material remains timely, accurate, useful and aligned to clients’ needs. The Relationship Manager will partner with the broader Partnered Distribution resource and the BNY Mellon teams to empower BNY Mellon’s business development efforts by assisting with the creation of product-specific training; educating clients and prospects on Newton’s investment process and solutions; and, where required, providing marketing material and associated portfolio information.  They will also support BNY Mellon business development, prospect and client relationship management efforts by providing portfolio messaging support to the BNY Mellon stakeholders. They will monitor and assist with new business opportunities and assist with the accurate tracking of these using Salesforce.The Relationship Manager will assist with Newton-related investment queries from stakeholders, liaising with different parts of both businesses to produce a timely and accurate response.  They may also be required to attend client and prospect meetings, as requested by BNY Mellon and/or Newton, to convey investment knowledge (as outlined above) or to host/coordinate the meeting if required.  This could be for IM EMEA, APAC or NA.Relationship management efforts will focus on contributing to the management of the distribution relationship and assist with the enhancement of processes and communication between both businesses, influencing the distribution agenda, driving accountability and establishing appropriate governance.  They will highlight any perceived opportunities and challenges to business growth or retention in the region to Head of Strategic Relationships EMEA and Newton’s Investment Specialist in APAC.  All meaningful interactions with BNY Mellon or other stakeholders will be documented, keeping other relevant stakeholder informed/copied into emails.  In addition to this, the Relationship Manager will, in collaboration with Newton’s Client Service team, support the servicing of BNY Mellon clients to ensure a high quality level of service, which is aligned to Newton’s client service capability where possible.  They will also assist with the coordination of portfolio manager interactions with BNY Mellon teams and clients/prospects, including visits to region, ensuring full briefing given to portfolio managers and other Newton staff in advance of meetings.

Product advocacy


Assist with the coordination and production of responses to stakeholder queries in a timely manner – seeking input from the broader Partnered Distribution team, Head of Strategic Relationships EMEA and the Newton investment team as required.  Share responses with colleagues and, where notable, other relevant teams across both businesses to drive efficiency; leverage global expertise; and encourage communication culture, idea generation and best practice.

Assist with the coordination and completion of RFPs and DDQs for opportunities in both the EMEA and APAC regions.

Assist with the coordination and planning for client or prospect meetings and the production of associated material, attending/hosting the meeting as required.

Assist with the education and empowerment of the BNY Mellon distribution teams, expanding coverage of Newton strategies.  Assist with the creation of product training to relevant BNY Mellon colleagues and distribution partners (e.g. intermediaries) as required; lead coordination and implementation of product training programs to meet BNY Mellon’s needs (as outlined in Newton-BNY Mellon Quarterly Boutique Reviews).

Convey knowledge to all stakeholders (defined above) in order to improve their understanding of Newton’s investment offering and portfolios; and support BNY Mellon’s distribution and business development efforts (and, in doing so, contribute to Newton revenue and AUM growth ambitions).

Company Overview:
Newton Investment Management Limited is an active investment management firm, using thematic ideas about the long-term investment landscape to create and manage strategies that help secure clients’ futures. Newton thinks on a global basis, with its single London-based investment team working collaboratively across asset classes and regions. The firm builds bold solutions, designed to meet the real-world challenges clients face, and the team manage them responsibly in the broadest sense – through embedding environmental, social and governance considerations, and engaging on issues that affect their clients. Those clients are based around the world, and include pension funds, corporations and charities and, via Newton’s parent company BNY Mellon, individuals. 
 
With offices in London and New York, Newton has £55bn (as at 30 September 2017) under management, including assets managed by Newton Investment Management Limited as dual officers of Newton Capital Management Limited and The Bank of New York Mellon. News and other information about Newton is available at www.newton.co.uk and via Twitter: @NewtonIM
 
Newton employees are bright, inquisitive, thoughtful and collaborative. They are highly motivated to deliver performance and service to clients.  Newton prides itself on being an employer of choice, with a flexible working environment and a commitment to diversity and opportunity among its employees.  
 
Newton is a professional, friendly and collegiate place to work. The firm looks to attract individuals who are keen to work as part of a team, in a meritocratic environment, and who are driven to help make the organisation a great place to work.  
Job Purpose:
The primary objective of the Relationship Manager EMEA is to strengthen Newton’s partnership with BNY Mellon Investment Management EMEA (IM EMEA) and APAC (IM APAC) in order to maximise Newton’s exposure and opportunities in the EMEA & APAC regions and including both institutional and intermediary channels. Collaborating closely with fellow members of the Newton Partnered Distribution team and Newton’s Investment Specialist located in APAC, this multi-faceted role includes the following responsibilities: 

Product advocacy – educate and empower the BNY Mellon IM distribution teams, expand coverage of Newton strategies.

Business development – collaborate with IM EMEA & APAC sales and Newton teams to identify, develop, assist with and monitor business opportunities for Newton.

Relationship management – contribute to the management of the distribution relationship, enhancing processes, influencing the distribution agenda, driving accountability, establishing appropriate governance.

Client servicing – support the servicing of IM EMEA & APAC clients to ensure a high quality level of service which is aligned to Newton’s client service capability where possible.
In order to execute these responsibilities, the Relationship Manager must develop and continually enhance an in-depth knowledge of investment management, the business and the portfolios/strategies most relevant to the EMEA & APAC regions, conveying this knowledge to all key stakeholders as required.  In doing so, the Relationship Manager will ensure that Newton’s solutions, as well as Newton’s/BNY Mellon’s messaging and investment-related material remains timely, accurate, useful and aligned to clients’ needs. The Relationship Manager will partner with the broader Partnered Distribution resource and the BNY Mellon teams to empower BNY Mellon’s business development efforts by assisting with the creation of product-specific training; educating clients and prospects on Newton’s investment process and solutions; and, where required, providing marketing material and associated portfolio information.  They will also support BNY Mellon business development, prospect and client relationship management efforts by providing portfolio messaging support to the BNY Mellon stakeholders. They will monitor and assist with new business opportunities and assist with the accurate tracking of these using Salesforce.The Relationship Manager will assist with Newton-related investment queries from stakeholders, liaising with different parts of both businesses to produce a timely and accurate response.  They may also be required to attend client and prospect meetings, as requested by BNY Mellon and/or Newton, to convey investment knowledge (as outlined above) or to host/coordinate the meeting if required.  This could be for IM EMEA, APAC or NA.Relationship management efforts will focus on contributing to the management of the distribution relationship and assist with the enhancement of processes and communication between both businesses, influencing the distribution agenda, driving accountability and establishing appropriate governance.  They will highlight any perceived opportunities and challenges to business growth or retention in the region to Head of Strategic Relationships EMEA and Newton’s Investment Specialist in APAC.  All meaningful interactions with BNY Mellon or other stakeholders will be documented, keeping other relevant stakeholder informed/copied into emails.  In addition to this, the Relationship Manager will, in collaboration with Newton’s Client Service team, support the servicing of BNY Mellon clients to ensure a high quality level of service, which is aligned to Newton’s client service capability where possible.  They will also assist with the coordination of portfolio manager interactions with BNY Mellon teams and clients/prospects, including visits to region, ensuring full briefing given to portfolio managers and other Newton staff in advance of meetings.

The Dreyfus Corporation, established in 1951 and headquartered in New York, is one of the nation's leading investment management and distribution companies, currently managing approximately $286 billion in mutual funds and separately managed accounts.  As part of BNY Mellon Investment Management, Dreyfus provides unique access to its exclusive and diverse global network of world-class asset managers, delivering powerful investment insight and strategies, including equity, fixed income and money market mutual funds, separately managed accounts, retirement and cash management strategies and asset allocation solutions.
 
The Role:
The Senior Internal Wholesaler plays a key role within Dreyfus for BNY Mellon Investment Management.  In partnership with the External Wholesaler, the Senior Internal Wholesaler – via outbound phone and email communication – develops and maintains existing relationships, and identifies and acquires new business within a specified territory to meet sales goals.  Working in close partnership with an external wholesaler, the Senior Internal Wholesaler works to develop and maintain meaningful client relationships with financial advisors at wirehouses and regional and independent broker/dealers in a geographic territory for the purpose of acquiring and retaining mutual fund and other professionally managed assets.
 
The Senior Internal Wholesaler raises and retains assets within a geographic territory by making proactive phone calls to financial advisers to share sales ideas, provide product information, gather marketing data and offer sales support. This individual develops and maintains relationships with existing financial advisers in order to sell Dreyfus funds and identify new sales opportunities. The Senior Internal Wholesaler also develops and implements a business plan and sales strategy with the External Wholesaler, and delivers effective presentations to promote Dreyfus funds and competitive advantages.
 
The Senior Internal Wholesaler must have an understanding of and passion for the sales process, as well as excellent verbal and written communications skills.  He or she must also have excellent organizational and follow up skills, and the ability to handle multiple responsibilities simultaneously.  Moreover, the Senior Internal Wholesaler must demonstrate professional presence, poise, strong presentation skills, and a high level of energy and motivation.

Build, grow, and maintain advisor relationships by developing a thorough understanding of Dreyfus funds and successfully position them to advisors
Develop a thorough understanding of the capital markets, the investment management industry, and marketplace developments – and leverage this knowledge to be a trusted advisor to clients and prospective clients and position Dreyfus funds effectively
Develop a thorough understanding of the sales process – and leverage it to assist in moving clients and opportunities to the next stage
Support the External Wholesaler in the development and execution of a strategic business plan to generate assets and grow share in the territory
Assess the needs of each client by asking targeted, high impact questions, and position the appropriate fund that meets those needs
